column2: Thanks for your review. For more than a year
column3: I researched the world of authentic Japanese ramen before deciding to open JINYA in my hometown of Houston. And in my visits to more than 50 ramen shops worldwide
column4: I have concluded that each is unique in its own way
column5: from the way they prepare their noodles to the price points they target -- some restaurants charge as little as $8 for a bowl of ramen
column6: while other high-end places charge as much as $20.
